description: The replacement of the existing two storey rear extension with a part full width and part half width two storey extension incorporating a first floor roof terrace
decision_conditions:
CONDITION: Prior to the commencement of any works on site a detailed method statement in accordance with BS 5837, 2005 'Trees in Relation to Construction' shall be submitted in writing for approval by the local planning authority. The method statement to include a plan showing the location of the tree root protection area  (RPA ) for the tree on the site and include details of  all works within the RPA including the careful hand demolition of the current surface treatment and identify any tree pruning works. The plan shall include the tree and ground protection to be erected and identify areas where no chemical or materials or equipment shall be stored, mixed or prepared, no fires or site washings, within the root protection area of the tree or under the canopy spread whichever is greater for the period of any demolition or construction activities on site. 

REASON: To avoid inappropriate excavations and damage to the trees, ensuring that disturbance to the roots of the tree is minimised and to maintain a healthy rooting area to ensure the long term health of the tree thereby its contribution to the amenity of the locality.  To protect the health and stability of trees to be retained on the site, and to ensure that a satisfactory standard of visual amenity is provided and maintained in accordance with policy 3D.15 of the London Plan 2008 and policy Env6 of the Islington UDP 2002.
